channel.title: Certification on Chris Neales Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Certification on Chris Neales Blog

item.title: VCP-NV=EZ
item.description: It’s been 2 weeks now since I sat and passed the VCP-NV. Straight after the exam I went on holiday and on coming back I got straight back into work. My background is working with VMware since Esx 2.x in 2005. In a more structured and career focussed way since 2011 when I did a great project to deploy 4 vBlocks with Linked vCenters. Since then I’ve worked on various virtualisation deployments, upgrades, support incidents (the joys of being on-call) and even a brief foray into setting up a Hyper-V environment for one customer!

item.title: VMware News Roundup - Announcement-ageddon!!!
item.description: There was armageddon, then snowmageddon and now announcementageddon. Twitter is on fire with frantic retweeting and updates on what people are excited about on the VMware front. And there’s plenty to be excited about right now. The biggest unsurprising but best bit is vSphere 6.0 goes GA. Now everyone can try long distance vmotion, VVols, 4vcpu Fault Tolerance, Instant Clone and more. Register for a trial and download below https://my.vmware.com/group/vmware/evalcenter?p=vsphere6#src=vmw_so_vex_cneal_850
